subject: RE: [junit] execute shell command in Junit to start server?
msgSnippet: Do you want to know if a specific program is started or if you can start programs from Java? _____ From: want111 [mailto:want111@yahoo.com] Sent: Tuesday, July
messageBody:
Do you want to know if a specific program is started or if you can start
programs from Java?

_____

From: want111 [mailto:want111@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 2004 12:17 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] execute shell command in Junit to start server?


Thanks for the previous helpful reply.

I have written this small piece of code that is
suppose to execute a shell code named "start" from the
bin which in turn starts the server. Is it the right
way? I don't need suite(), setUp() or tearDown()?


package junit.samples;
import junit.framework.*;
import java.util.*;

class ser extends TestCase {

public ser(String name) {
super(name)
}

public void testProgramStarted(){

rtime = Runtime.getRuntime();
Process child = rtime.exec("/bin");


BufferedWriter outCommand = new BufferedWriter(new
OutputStreamWriter(child.getOutputStream()));
outCommand.writeLine("start");
outCommand.flush();
}


public static void main(String[] args)
{
ser s= new ser();
s.stProgramStarted();

}
}
